plants.name: Aloe Vera
plants.description: Aloe vera is a succulent plant. An evergreen perennial, it originates from the Arabian Peninsula, but grows wild in tropical, semi-tropical, and arid climates around the world. It is cultivated for agricultural and medicinal uses. The species is also used for decorative purposes and grows successfully indoors as a potted plant.

plants.name: Snake Plant
plants.description: commonly known as snake plant, mother-in-law's tongue, or viper's bowstring hemp, is a flowering plant species in the family Asparagaceae, native to West Africa. It is a succulent plant, with stiff, sword-shaped leaves that grow in rosettes from a short stem. It is a popular houseplant.
plants.funFact: The snake plant is a succulent plant that can survive for months without water.
plants.funFact2: If you pluck a leaf from a snake plant and cut it into 3" pieces, you can grow each into a new plant.

plants.name: Monstera Deliciosa
plants.funFact: The name Monstera deliciosa is derived from the Latin word monstrosus, meaning monstrous, and the Spanish word delicioso, meaning delicious.
plants.funFact2: The plant was named by Carl Linnaeus in 1753, who described it as a monstrous plant with delicious fruit.The fruit tastes like a combination of pineapple, banana, and mango! However, it's not as simple as just picking the fruit and eating it. The fruit is only ripe and safe to eat once it has fallen off the plant and started to decompose on the ground. Legend has it that the indigenous people of Central and South America used to tie the ripe fruit to a stick and leave it out in the sun to rot until it was soft and mushy. Then, they would use the stick to scoop out the delicious fruit from the inside. So, while Monstera deliciosa is most commonly grown as a houseplant for its ornamental leaves, it's also a tasty treat for those who are willing to put in a bit of effort to enjoy its fruit!
plants.description: A species of flowering plant native to tropical forests of southern Mexico, through Central America to northern South America. It is a climbing or trailing vine, growing to 10 m tall or more with aerial roots. The leaves are large, 30-60 cm long and 15-45 cm broad, with a deeply lobed margin

plants.name: Pothos
plants.description: Pothos is a genus of flowering plants in the family Araceae (tribe Potheae). The genus is native to Southeast Asia and New Guinea. It is currently defined to contain only two species. The name Pothos is derived from the Greek word for "drink" or "food", and is a common plant in the home.

plants.name: Lavender
plants.description: Lavender is a genus of about 30 species of plants in the family Lamiaceae and is native to countries bordering the Mediterranean. It is a shrub that grows to be about 1â€“2 meters tall. Lavender is well-known for its fragrant flowers.
plants.funFact: Lavender oil can be used for aromatherapy.
plants.funFact2: The plant is also used in culinary dishes.

plants.name: Orchid
plants.description: Orchids make up one of the largest plant families and are known for their often intricate and delicate flowers. They can be found all over the world.
plants.funFact: Some orchid species can live to be 100 years old.
plants.funFact2: Orchids have a symmetry similar to human faces.

plants.name: Peace Lily
plants.description: The Peace Lily is a popular indoor plant, known for its ability to break down certain harmful chemicals like benzene, formaldehyde, and other pollutants.
plants.funFact: Despite its name, the Peace Lily is not a true lily.
plants.funFact2: It is relatively easy to care for and can grow in low light conditions.

plants.name: Fiddle-Leaf Fig
plants.description: The Fiddle-Leaf Fig is known for its dramatic leaves that are shaped like a fiddle. It is native to western Africa and grows in lowland tropical rainforest.
plants.funFact: This plant can grow up to 6 feet or taller indoors.
plants.funFact2: It's a favorite among interior designers.

plants.name: Spider Plant
plants.description: The Spider Plant is known for its ability to purify air and is one of the most common houseplants. It is native to southern Africa.
plants.funFact: Spider plants are non-toxic and safe for pets.
plants.funFact2: They produce 'pups' which can be easily replanted.
